META.slideshow_title: Caught in the opioid snare: A photo essay

PHOTOS.caption: Drug paraphernalia is seen on a camp table as Frank, left, who asked not to use his last name, and his wife Chaney clear out of a camp site behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd.
Frank and Chaney agreed to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope and taken to the shelter to go to detox on Tuesday, Sept. 12, 2017. They had to have a fix before they would go.
Frank and Chaney agreed to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope and taken to the shelter to go to detox on Tuesday, Sept. 12, 2017. They had to have a fix before they would go.
Frank and Chaney agreed to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope and taken to the shelter to go to detox on Tuesday, Sept. 12, 2017. They had to have a fix before they would go.
Frank wraps a cord around his arm to shoot up.
Frank lived in a tent with his wife Chaney behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd before agreeing to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter to detox.
Frank lived in a tent with his wife Chaney behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd before agreeing to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter to detox.
Frank lived in a tent with his wife Chaney behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd before agreeing to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter to detox.
Frank lived in a tent with his wife Chaney behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd before agreeing to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter to detox.
Frank lived in a tent with his wife Chaney behind a store on Old Pearsall Rd before agreeing to go with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter to detox.

Frank prepares to throw away his heroin equipment before going with Ron Brown of Haven for Hope to the shelter for detox, on Tuesday. "I might be a heroin addict, but I'm a clean heroin addict," he commented as he broke the needles off before throwing them away.
Frank and Chaney leave their camp site.
Victoria Ortiz, holds her daughter Gracie Guajardo surrounded by other family members during a Child Dedication service at The Salvation Army Center for Worship and Service. Sunday, Sept. 17, 2017.
Ortiz, 30, left, sings "Jesus loves you", to her 10 mo. old daughter, during a nap at her sister's house on Wednesday, Sept. 6, 2017.
Ortiz, takes her daughter to a Child Dedication service at The Salvation Army Center for Worship and Service. Sunday, Sept. 17, 2017.

Ortiz, left, lets her daughter play with her sister Velma Ortiz's daughter Julissa Rodriguez, right, following a Child Dedication service at The Salvation Army Center for Worship and Service. Sunday, Sept. 17, 2017.
Ortiz carries her locked metal methadone box that she's decorated, on her way to pick up a week's dosage on Wednesday, Sept. 7, 2017.
Ortiz and her daughter play at her sister's house on Wednesday, Sept. 6, 2017.
Ortiz holds her locked methadone box in the room she and her daughter share at her parent's house on Thursday, Oct. 12, 2017.
Ortiz inspects her doses of methadone that she keeps in her personalized locked metal case in her room at her parent's house on Thursday, Oct. 12, 2017.
Ortiz has overcome opioid addiction, including heroin, and now is a mainstay at a support group for mothers who gave birth to addicted babies.
Ortiz decorated her locked methadone box with jewels and glitter with the message, "Don't Touch."
Ortiz and her daughter play at her sister's house on Wednesday, Sept. 6, 2017.

Cynthia Dandridge, a drug counselor for the Center for Health Care Services, kicked her heroin habit, was able to get away from her own dysfunctional family, and now is married and has a home of her own, raising her grandchildren.

Cynthia Dandridge, a drug counselor for the Center for Health Care Services, kicked her heroin habit, was able to get away from her own dysfunctional family, and now is married and has a home of her own, raising her grandchildren.
A mother passes a bulletin board with photos of babies born to addicted mothers, at the Center for Health Care Services, on Thursday, Sept. 7, 2017. Mothers attend Mommies Class at the center.

Mary Bobbitt overcame heroin addiction, which started out years prior when she started taking pain killers for migraines. She spends time rebuilding her relationship with her daughter Brielle Bobbitt, 5, on Tuesday, Sept. 5, 2017.

Mary Bobbitt overcame heroin addiction, which started out years prior when she started taking pain killers for migraines. She spends time rebuilding her relationship with her daughter Brielle Bobbitt, 5, on Tuesday, Sept. 5, 2017.

Mary Bobbitt overcame heroin addiction, which started out years prior when she started taking pain killers for migraines. She spends time rebuilding her relationship with her daughter Brielle Bobbitt, 5, on Tuesday, Sept. 5, 2017.

Jimmy, high on a substance, agreed to have his picture taken if we don't use his last name. Sean Baker, an outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services, was handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he encountered along S. New Braunfels, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.

"Angel" drinks a beer outside a convenient store on N. Zarzamora where Sean Baker, an Outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services was handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he finds, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017. "Angel" said she doesn't do heroin.

Jesse Alvarez shows the track marks on his arm from shooting heroin. Sean Baker an Outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services, visited a known location where addicts hang out on S. New Braunfels, handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he finds, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.

Two unidentified women, both heroin addicts, exchange words in front of a strip mall on S. New Braunfels, where Sean Baker an Outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services, was handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he finds, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.
A syringe is seen behind a restaurant on S. New Braunfels where addicts hangout. Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.

Liz shows track marks on her neck where she shoots heroin. Sean Baker, an outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services, was visiting a strip mall on S. New Braunfels, handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he finds, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.

An unidentified woman shows the track marks on her arm from shooting heroin. Sean Baker an Outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services, visited a known location where addicts hang out on S. New Braunfels, handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts he finds, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.

Albert Rivera, right, known as a gate keeper in his west side neighborhood, helps addicts when they overdose, by administering narcan to them. Sean Baker, left, an outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services supplies him with narcan.

Sean Baker, an outreach worker with Center for Health Care Services grabs a handful of condoms, as he and Arturo Martinez, make their rounds on N. Zarzamora, handing out personal care bags, water, snacks, and condoms to addicts they find, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.
Baker performs a test on "Montana" checking for HIV, Hep C and syphilis.
Baker fills out paper work before performing a blood test on "Montana" checking for HIV, Hep C and syphilis.
Baker explains to Liz, a heroin addict, how to administer narcan nasal spray, near a strip mall on S. New Braunfels, on Monday, Sept. 25, 2017.
Julie Cavlovic sits near a photo of her daughter Kimbra Cavlovic who died from heroin use two years ago at the age of 21, on Friday, Sept. 22, 2017.
